DPRK Delegation Back Home 
   Pyongyang, December 23 (KCNA) -- The DPRK delegation headed by Vice-Minister of Foreign Affairs Kim Kye Gwan returned home on Saturday after participating in the six-party talks.
 It was greeted at the airport by Vice-Minister of Foreign Affairs Kim Yong Il and officials concerned, Chinese Ambassador to the DPRK Liu Xiaoming and Russian Charge d'Affaires here Alexander Matsegora.

Stop to Anti-DPRK Campaign and Political Suppression of Koreans in Japan Called for
   Pyongyang, December 24 (KCNA) -- The Central Headquarters of the New Socialist Party of Japan and the Japan-Korea Society for Scientific and Educational Interchange made public a joint statement entitled "The Japanese government, police and public security authorities should halt anti-DPRK campaign and political suppression of Koreans in Japan" on Dec. 5.
 The anti-DPRK campaign of political force and media of Japan and their suppression of Koreans in Japan are getting all the more pronounced, the statement said, stressing these are destroying the idea of peace, democracy and human rights in Japan and violating the Japan-DPRK Pyongyang Declaration.    
 We demand the government stop all sorts of national discrimination, suppression and sanctions and fully guarantee the efforts for Japan-DPRK relations and all national rights, it stated.

Reception Given to Mark Vietnam's Army Day
   Pyongyang, December 23 (KCNA) -- Phan Trong Thai, Vietnamese ambassador to the DPRK, hosted a reception at his embassy here on Dec. 22 on the occasion of the army day of his country.
 Present there on invitation were general officers, officers and officials concerned.    
 Embassy officials of Vietnam were present there.
 Speeches were made there.

articles.content:
Condolences to Deputy Prime Minister of Turkmenistan
   Pyongyang, December 23 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Friday sent a message of condolences to Berdimuhammedov, deputy prime minister and minister of Health of Turkmenistan, over the death of its President Saparmurat Atayevich Niyazov from sudden illness.
 Kim Yong Nam expressed deep regret and condolences to him and, through him, to the members of the bereaved family.

Message of Condolences to Turkmen FM
   Pyongyang, December 23 (KCNA) -- DPRK Foreign Minister Paek Nam Sun sent a message of condolences to his Turkmen counterpart Rashid Meredov upon the death of President Saparmurat Atayevich Niyazov from sudden illness.

articles.title: Wreath to Bust of Kim Jong Suk from Anti-Japanese Revolutionary Fighter in China
articles.content:
Floral Basket to Kim Jong Il from Chinese Family
   Pyongyang, December 23 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il received a floral basket from the family of Zhang Weihua, an anti-Japanese revolutionary martyr, on the occasion of the 15th anniversary of his assumption of office as supreme commander of the Korean People's Army.
 Written on the ribbon of the floral basket were letters reading "Good health to the great leader Comrade Kim Jong Il".

articles.title: Congratulations to Swiss President
articles.content:
Wreath to Bust of Kim Jong Suk from Family of Anti-Japanese Revolutionary Fighter in China
   Pyongyang, December 23 (KCNA) -- A wreath was sent to the bust of anti-Japanese war hero Kim Jong Suk at the Revolutionary Martyrs Cemetery on Mt. Taesong by the family of So Sun Ok, anti-Japanese revolutionary fighter in China, on the occasion of her 89th birth anniversary.
 The wreath was placed before her bust Saturday by So Sun Ok's son Kim Jin Song, general manager of the Putong Zhiyuan Trading Co., Ltd, in Beijing of China.

Congratulations to Swiss President
   Pyongyang, December 23 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Friday sent a congratulatory message to Micheline Calmy�|Rey upon his election as president of Switzerland.
 Kim Yong Nam in the message expressed the conviction that the friendly and cooperative relations between the DPRK and Switzerland would continue to favorably develop in the interests of the two peoples in the future, too, and wished him success in his responsible work.
